Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) is the most common material used as a solid oxide electrolyte, which is a key component in solid oxide fuel cells, solid oxide electrolysis cells, and certain chemical sensors.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: High efficiency in these devices requires increased oxygen ion conductance at intermediate temperatures.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: Nanoscale YSZ thin films are quite promising in this regard, as the conduction path may be reduced below what is conventionally achievable.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: Still, as the thickness is decreased to nanoscale, structural properties like lattice parameter and grain morphology are typically altered.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: These may affect the electrochemical properties in non-trivial ways.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: Recent reports on nanoscale YSZ thin films have provided inconsistent and, at times, controversial results.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: In this paper, we present a review of reports on nanoscale YSZ thin films, focusing principally on single component YSZ films as opposed to heterogeneous multilayer films.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: Reports of significantly increased conductivity come from studies that use a variety of substrates, grain morphologies, and, to some extent, film thicknesses.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films

Sentencas: Mechanical strain in the films is not typically reported but is a suspected cause of the variability in conductivity.
Titulo: On the variability of reported ionic conductivity in nanoscale YSZ thin films
